verses.name: Job 21:1
verses.text: But Job answered and said,

verses.name: Job 21:2
verses.text: Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.

verses.name: Job 21:3
verses.text: Suffer me that I may speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.

verses.name: Job 21:4
verses.text: As for me, is my complaint to man? and if it were so, why should not my spirit be troubled?

verses.name: Job 21:5
verses.text: Mark me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth.

verses.name: Job 21:6
verses.text: Even when I remember I am afraid, and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.

verses.name: Job 21:7
verses.text: Wherefore do the wicked live, become old, yea, are mighty in power?

verses.name: Job 21:8
verses.text: Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.

verses.name: Job 21:9
verses.text: Their houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of God upon them.

verses.name: Job 21:10
verses.text: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.

verses.name: Job 21:11
verses.text: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.

verses.name: Job 21:12
verses.text: They take the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the organ.

verses.name: Job 21:13
verses.text: They spend their days in wealth, and in a moment go down to the grave.

verses.name: Job 21:14
verses.text: Therefore they say unto God, Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.

verses.name: Job 21:15
verses.text: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?

verses.name: Job 21:16
verses.text: Lo, their good is not in their hand: the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

verses.name: Job 21:17
verses.text: How oft is the candle of the wicked put out! and how oft cometh their destruction upon them! God distributeth sorrows in his anger.

verses.name: Job 21:18
verses.text: They are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.

verses.name: Job 21:19
verses.text: God layeth up his iniquity for his children: he rewardeth him, and he shall know it.

verses.name: Job 21:20
verses.text: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.

verses.name: Job 21:21
verses.text: For what pleasure hath he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?

verses.name: Job 21:22
verses.text: Shall any teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.

verses.name: Job 21:23
verses.text: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet.

verses.name: Job 21:24
verses.text: His breasts are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow.

verses.name: Job 21:25
verses.text: And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.

verses.name: Job 21:26
verses.text: They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.

verses.name: Job 21:27
verses.text: Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.

verses.name: Job 21:28
verses.text: For ye say, Where is the house of the prince? and where are the dwelling places of the wicked?

verses.name: Job 21:29
verses.text: Have ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens,

verses.name: Job 21:30
verses.text: That the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction? they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.

verses.name: Job 21:31
verses.text: Who shall declare his way to his face? and who shall repay him what he hath done?

verses.name: Job 21:32
verses.text: Yet shall he be brought to the grave, and shall remain in the tomb.

verses.name: Job 21:33
verses.text: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as there are innumerable before him.

verses.name: Job 21:34
verses.text: How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood?
